meanings.definition: To twist and turn the body with quick, sinuous movements.
meanings.sent1: The snake can wriggle through narrow spaces easily.
meanings.sent2: The toddler loves to wriggle around on the floor while playing.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar decided to wriggle its way out of the tangled yarn.
meanings.sent4: She managed to wriggle out of attending the boring meeting.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman watched the fish wriggle on the line before releasing it back into the water.

meanings.sent1: The puppy's wriggle of excitement when its owner returned was adorable.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast's routine included a graceful wriggle that impressed the judges.
meanings.sent3: The wriggle of the earthworms after the rain made the sidewalk slippery.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's performance ended with a dramatic wriggle that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The wriggle of the snake as it escaped into the bushes was mesmerizing to watch.
